data.sampled:
Kazakhstan
Kazakhstan is located in Central Asia and is the ninth-largest country by land mass. It has an area of approximately 1.6 million square miles (2.7 million square kilometers) and shares borders with seven other countries: Russia to the north and west; China to the east; India to the southeast; Pakistan to the south; Iran to the southwest; Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, and Kyrgyzstan to the west; and Tajikistan to the southwest. Additionally, Kazakhstan also has coastline along the Caspian Sea. As the world's second-largest landlocked country after Canada, it covers much of the central Eurasian Steppe and extends across multiple geographical regions including the flatlands of Western Siberia; the oval-shaped plateau known as the Kazakh Melkosopochnik; the hilly terrain of the Middle Horde and South Kazakhstania Regions; and the rugged landscape of the eastern slopes of the Altay Mountains. The highest point in Kazakhstan is Khan Tengri at 25,903 feet (7,890 meters), which straddles its southern border with both Kyrgyzstan and China. The lowest point in Kazakhstan is the Karagiye Depression at -433 feet (-132 meters), which lies within the Central Asian Ridge in the Aktobe Region near the western border with Russian Federation. Overall, nearly all of Kazakhstan's territory falls below 3,300 feet (1,000 meters). Approximately two-thirds of the population lives no further than 18 miles (30 km) from the Chinese or Russian borders. Major cities include Nur-Sultan, Almaty, Shymkent, Aty

data.sampled:
Brazil, India, Argentina and Australia are all large countries by population, but only in terms of landmass is Brazil larger than India, Argentina and Australia.
India has an area of 3287590 km², which makes it the sixth-largest country by area. Although much smaller than Russia or Canada, it's still considerably larger than its other neighbours.
Australia covers an area of about 7682300 km² - making it slightly smaller than India, although again it's by far the largest nation in Oceania.
Argentina has an area of around 2780400 km². It is about half the size of Algeria and just over a third of the size of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). This makes Argentina approximately as large as the US state of Texas.
Brazil however, has an area of 8515777.4km², which is almost twice that of Argentina. In fact this means it is bigger than both Australia and India. The vast Amazon rainforest is largely located within Brazil's borders, contributing to most of its territory. However, while it may be considered very sparsely populated for such a large nation, it remains one of the world's most populous nations at roughly two hundred and twenty million people.

The following code demonstrates how to compute and compare areas for each country. If you run this script, you will see that Mongolia is indeed the country with the largest area.
#!/bin/bash
for i in "Iran","Libya","Mongolia","Peru"; do

done
echo ""
echo "Maximum Area: $((($(echo 'scale=2; ($((('Iran_km2') + ('Libya_km2')) < ('Mongolia_km2') || ('Iran_km2') > ('Libya_km2'))' | bc))) * 1000)) km^2)"

data.sampled:
The correct answer is Mongolia. 
Mongolia is a landlocked country in east-central Asia that spans an area of approximately 1,566,000 square kilometers (604,247 sq mi). It is the world's nineteenth-largest nation by land area and has a population of around three million people. Ulaanbaatar is its capital city.
China borders it to the southwest while Russia borders it to the north. The eastern border abuts Kazakhstan which itself borders China and Russia. In terms of topography, much of western Mongolia is mountainous whereas most of the eastern part of the country consists of rolling plateaus at an average altitude of about 1,580 meters (5,187 feet), giving rise to the term "the roof of the world." This region is home to the Gobi Desert. The country experiences an extreme continental climate with long cold winters and short summers. Average temperatures vary from −30 °C (−22 °F) in January to +38 °C (100 °F) in July.[19] Annual precipitation varies from 20 km2 (8 sq mi) in the desert to more than 500 millimeters (200 inches) per year in the mountains. The country contains very little vegetation - only about 1% of the total landmass. The national language is called Khalkha Mongol. About one third of the population lives below the international poverty line. Economic growth however remains steady, with agricultural production being one of the main drivers. Its currency is the tughrik. Mongolia is a unitary parliamentary constitutional republic in Central Asia. The President serves as head of state and gets elected for a four-year term. The Prime Minister, who
